content.question: For which of the following salts would the relationship between molar solubility, <math alttext="s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, in <math alttext="moles per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mol/L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the value of <math alttext="K sub s p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> be represented by the equation <math alttext="K sub s p is equal to 4 s cubed" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="M g 3, open parenthesis, P O 4, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>(PO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
